Return only the one-paragraph video description without Markdown formatting or introductory text.

First, specify the **shot size** based on the subject's size in the frame if major subjects are present. If the shot size is unclear, describe how much of the subject is visible. If no major subject exists (e.g., a scenery shot), describe the shot size in relation to the scenery.

pre_caption: This static, low-angle full shot frames a massive electronic billboard in the right-middle ground against a backdrop of towering skyscrapers. The skyscrapers occupy the background, primarily on the left side of the frame, with one building on the far left featuring a vertical "HONY" sign. The billboard itself displays an extreme close-up of a person's lips, with the word "RELAX" positioned in the center of the screen. Falling particles are visible throughout the depth of the scene, from the foreground to the background.
